specJson.name: brightics.function.transform$delete_missing_data
specJson.label: Delete Missing Data
specJson.description: Delete data with more than x% missing values

params.label: Input Columns
params.description: The name of columns to check.

params.label: Missing values ratio
params.description: Delete data with more than x% missing values. Default value = 1 (delete nothing)

md: ## Format ### Python ``` from brightics.function import brightics.function.transform$delete_missing_data res = brightics.function.transform$delete_missing_data(table = , input_cols = , input_cols = , how = , thresh = ) res['out_table'] ``` ## Description Removes rows when the chosen columns have abnormal values. --- ## Properties ### VA #### Inputs 1. **table***: table #### Parameters 1. **Input Column**: The name of columns to check whether they have abnormal values. If no column is selected, check all columns. Long, Integer, Double, String, Boolean, Float are allowed. 2. **How**: Determine if row or column is removed from DataFrame, when we have at least one NA or all NA. - Any : If any NA values are present, drop that row or column. - All : If all values are NA, drop that row or column. Choose among Anyall. 3. **Threshold**: Require that many non-NA values. #### Outputs 1. **out_table**: table ### Python #### Inputs 1. **table***: table #### Parameters 1. **input_cols**: The name of columns to check whether they have abnormal values. If no column is selected, check all columns. Long, Integer, Double, String, Boolean, Float are allowed. 2. **how**: Determine if row or column is removed from DataFrame, when we have at least one NA or all NA. - Any : If any NA values are present, drop that row or column. - All : If all values are NA, drop that row or column. Choose among anyall. 3. **thresh**: Require that many non-NA values. #### Outputs 1. **out_table**: table
